Discussions.Discussion_Name: Lecture and guest lecture July 1st online

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear students, next Monday's lecture and guest lecture (July 1st) will be online lectures via WEBEX. You can find the corresponding Webex link in the ISIS course in the week-section for the lecture. The week after (July 8th), we will have the last lecture by Knut Blind and an exam preparation session. Have a wonderful weekend and see you Monday online, Charlotte

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Time change Prof Blind's lecture today, guest lecture as planned at 16:15

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear students, Today’s lecture by Prof Knut Blind will take place 13:00-14:30 in room H4136 due to an appointment with the state secretary at BMWK later this afternoon. We apologize for the inconvenience this might cause on your end. In case you cannot make it to the lecture due to this last-minute schedule change, the slides will be uploaded to ISIS, and there will be time to address questions about them in next week’s lecture. The guest lecture on innovation policy in the US by Linda Johnson will take place as planned: 16:15-17:45 in H3007.  See you all at the guest lecture, Charlotte

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Announcements: Guest lecture next week and exam date

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear all, Next week, there will only be an online guest lecture at 2:15 pm. I posted the Zoom link in the ISIS course. There will be no lecture by Knut Blind next week. Since we are quite a small group this semester, I am proposing to do just one exam date: the exam would take place on 15.7.24 (16:00-17:00, room H3007). In case you cannot attend the exam on this date, please write me an email (c.rochell@tu-berlin.de) until 30.6.24 and we will find a solution. Best, Charlotte

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Other room for lecture and guest lecture today

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear all, today's lecture and guest lecture takes place  in room PC 203. You can find the campus map here: https://www.static.tu.berlin/fileadmin/www/10000000/Studieren/Uni-Leben/Campusplaene/Plan_Campus_Charlottenburg.pdf Sorry for the late notice! See you all there, Charlotte

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Visit at the Steel factory of the GMH Group !

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, I would like to inform you about the possibility to participate at a factory visit at the steel factory of GMH Group in Osnabrück on the 28th of June. The steel factory is partly run by our former PhD Anne-Marie Großmann, who is one of the 100 most influential women in the German economy (Link) and actively transitioning her company to green steel production (Link). She is a very prominent figure in the green steel transition and I am thus very proud that we are able to visit the company's factory. Our general plan is to depart Berlin early in the morning via bus or train and be back in Berlin in the early evening, so you can enjoy your Friday evening as well.  Bear in mind that the Chair of Innovation Economics will organize the transportation and cover the travel costs. As seats are very limited (only 20 people incl. me can visit the factory), it is very important that you really attend if you signed up. If you’re interested, please write an email to Julia Gräfe (julia.graefe@tu-berlin.de). Best regards, Sokol Tominaj

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Student Assistant Position at the Chair of Innovation Economics

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear students, The Chair of Innovation Economics is looking for a teaching and research assistant (40h/month). We offer you insights into the chair's work, teaching, academic research, high flexibility, and a great work environment. German language skills are not a requirement for this position. You can find the job posting here https://www.jobs.tu-berlin.de/en/job-postings/183235 . The application deadline is 20.06.2024. If you have any questions regarding the position, don't hesitate to contact Sokol Tominaj or me. We are looking forward to your applications!  Have a lovely end of the week, Charlotte

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Hi everyone, The points for the first reflection paper submissions are online. You can find the grading scheme for this class here: https://www.inno.tu-berlin.de/menue/teaching/faq/information_about_exams/#faq3. From now on, I will always update the results document as soon as the grading is finished without writing an Isis announcement. Please contact me via email in case you have any questions. See you in 1.5 week for the lecture and the guest lecture by Olaf Kranz on Innovation Policy in the UK. Have a nice rest of the week and a wonderful long weekend, Charlotte

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear all, The deadline for the portfolio exam registration is approaching: Please remember to register via MOSES until May 15th (this Wednesday). See you later for our second guest lecture, Charlotte

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Q&A Reflection Papers and 1st Guest Lecture

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear all, Next Monday, we will have a Q&A for the reflection papers (starting at 3pm) followed by the first guest lecture by Dr. Ramanuj Banerjee, Science Counselor, Embassy of India Berlin (at 4:15 pm). There will be no lecture by Knut Blind next week. Looking forward to seeing you all there, best, Charlotte

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear students, Welcome to the course „Innovation Policy”! Thank you for your interest in the class and the nice first lecture yesterday. I uploaded all relevant course material. Please have a look at the course organization slides if you missed the first session. Please remember to register for the course through the registration form. Registration ends this Sunday, April 21st 2024. Every interested student will get a spot in the class, we just need you to register to have a complete list of participants. Next week, we will have the second and third lecture by Knut Blind (from 2 to 6). Best, Charlotte

Messages.Author: Kimberli Troka
Messages.Content: Hello,  Will we have the points for the questions submitted before the exam pls?  Thank you!

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Hi Kimberli,  You will get these points with your exam results.  Best, Charlotte

Messages.Author: Toshina-Wibke Jensen
Messages.Content: Dear Charlotte,  You have already posted on ISIS that the exam for the Innovation Policy module will take place on July 15th. We still have a lecture one week prior: L13: Demand-Side Instruments: Public Procurement I need to ask now because I will be taking exams from the beginning of July. Will L13 still be included in the exam, even though we only have one week?! --or perhaps asked more politely: Will any content be omitted from the exam? [since even two weeks before the exam is tight] I apologize in advance for asking.  Best regards, Toshina

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear Toshina,  we will discuss all these matters in the exam preparation session.  Kind regards, Charlotte

Messages.Author: Kimberli Troka
Messages.Content: Hi, is anyone still looking for a partner to write the papers?

Messages.Author: Wassim Al Shami
Messages.Content: Hello, I am still searching for a partner to work on the papers together, please if anyone is interested pm me. Regards, Wassim.
